title: Distant Blade
opening: Eirika chooses to travel by sea to the theocracy of Rausten. Her search for a ship leads her to Port Kiris in Carcino. Carcino is a young nation ruled by a council of merchants, and it is an ally of Frelia. Carcino council leader Klimt, a staunch opponent of Grado’s imperialistic actions, has pledged Carcino’s support to Frelia in this conflict. Prince Innes also intends to pass through Carcino on his way to Jehanna. Eirika believes there is nothing to fear in Carcino, but she is wrong.

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Frelia’s Sacred Stone has been destroyed. And yet you cannot locate the Stone of Renais. Glen. Valter. Find the children of Renais. Find them and take from them the bracelets that they wear. Glen, take Eirika. Valter, take Ephraim. Find them. Conquer them.

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Yes, Your Majesty...

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Ha ha... Eirika, eh? She’s a ripe little peach. And her brother, Ephraim... He’s better prey than I’d imagined. I can feel my blood rushing at the thought. This might be fun after all.

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Caellach. Riev. Shatter the remaining Sacred Stones. Caellach, take Jehanna. Riev, take Rausten. Go. Crush the Sacred Stones they house.

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh... As you will. I’ll begin making arrangements for Rausten’s downfall immediately...

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Bah! Why am I stuck with Jehanna? Accursed ill luck. I became a mercenary to escape that wretched place, and now I must go back?

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Duessel. Go to Frelia. Take the Frelian army and punish Ephraim.

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Selena. Remain in the capital. Soon, I will have new orders for you.

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: Yes, sire.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Eirika! Wait!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Tana? What are you doing? You were supposed to remain in the palace. You left so abruptly, without any warning or farewell. You and Ephraim have only just arrived, and already you leave on another quest? Well, I’m your friend, Eirika, and I won’t let you go into danger without me.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Does King Hayden know of this?

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: No. He’d just say I forbid you to go on this foolish errand,? like always. But I’m so worried about you.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Thank you, Tana. I appreciate your concern, but King Hayden would–

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: You and Ephraim, my father and my brother... You’re all fighting together, fighting for a noble cause. I cannot be left out. I will not be left out. Please, Eirika.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: ...Oh... All right. I never could refuse you anything. Come on. Let’s go, Tana.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Thank you, Eirika!

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Your Highness, we’ve reached Port Kiris. If we can find passage across the North Sea, we will reach Rausten in 10 days.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: It smells of the tides... This is a busy place, isn’t it?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: It’s a trade center. Peoples of all nations pass through here. Do not become so enthralled with the sights and sounds that you forget your mission.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: I won’t. I’m a mercenary by the name of Erina. I’m traveling to Rausten to receive a commission.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Let us look for a ship then, Erina. The docks are this way.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Is something amiss?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Seth, that woman over there? Is that...

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Oh, these dainty sugar pastries! They’re delightfully scrumptious! Flavorful without being overwhelming, refined without being banal...

intro.speaker: Dozla
intro.line: Gwah ha ha! Right you are, Lady L’Arachel!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: You look familiar...

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Oh! Aren’t you–

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: We’ve met before, haven’t we? You arrived with your companions when we encountered those creatures... Your name is L’Arachel, is it not?

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: A wonder and pleasure that we should meet again so soon! It is providence!

intro.speaker: Rennac
intro.line: Bad luck is the only thing the divine has ever provided you!

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Oh, and if you have not yet tried one, these pastries are also divine. Would you care for one?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Uh, thank you... No, wait... That’s not why– We’re actually on our way to the Theocracy of Rausten. We’re rather in a rush and need to find passage on a ship...

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Oh, dear. I’m afraid you’ll find none to assist you. No ships are leaving port.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Pardon?

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: You see, I find myself heading home once more to my beloved Rausten as well! And actually, I’m quite well known with the powers-that-be here in Port Kiris. So I ordered them to ready the finest passenger vessel for me. But both merchants and passenger ships alike are too frightened to set sail. It seems a giant ghost ship has been sinking every ship it finds... Would that I could confront it, I could stop its foul villainy in a moment. Alas. It’s such a shame.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Yes, yes... Uh... That is troublesome. Still, I must get to Rausten somehow.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: You needn’t worry too much. After all, if the sea is closed to you, simply follow the overland route!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: The overland route? I’ve heard that’s a terribly roundabout path to travel.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Oh, it is, but don’t you see? The hardships of the road, they are truly blessings! They will toughen you and strengthen your resolve when you need to face great evil. For example, I have been tasked with a great trial in order to better me. I understand my path, O unknowable forces of providence! I, your faithful servant L’Arachel, shall overcome! With faith and divine strength!

intro.speaker: Rennac
intro.line: Now, listen, L’Arachel! You might be thrilled about going the long way, but–

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Come now, we’re leaving. Dozla? Rennac? Don’t fall behind!

intro.speaker: Dozla
intro.line: Gwah ha ha! Wait for us, Lady L’Arachel! Come on, Rennac! We run ’til we drop! The first one to collapse from exhaustion is the winner!

intro.speaker: Rennac
intro.line: Help... Why is this happening to me?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: ...Uh, Seth? Isn’t Rausten in the other direction? Aren’t they heading toward Frelia?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: ...It’s nothing you need concern yourself with, milady. Our only concern now is to decide our next course of action. An overland journey would be very long. However, it seems that may be our only choice at the moment...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: I agree. Whatever shall we do...

intro.speaker: Binks
intro.line: ...You’re Eirika, the princess of Renais, ain’t ya?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Dastard! Away with you!

intro.speaker: Binks
intro.line: No need to get personal! You know, there’s a pretty price on your pretty head. Sorry, but I need that gold.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Wh-what do you want? Gimme a break... Leave us out of this stupid war of yours! We don’t want anything to do with it! Or... are you just another victim, like the rest of us here? Well, regardless... Here. Take this, and go do something about all this fighting, will you?

visit.speaker: Rennac
visit.line: My, oh my... It’s about time they left. I’m finally done getting ordered about without getting paid. Huh? Oh, don’t mind me. Just talking to myself. Here, I want you to hold on to this for me. Don’t tell anyone. Oh, and don’t say a word about seeing me to Lady L’Arachel, all right? Deal?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Attention! Carcino’s mercenaries will arrest the princess of Renais shortly. Our duty here is nearly ended, and I expect no further hostilities. If you must fight, however, remember that the whole empire fights with you!

battle.speaker: Amelia
battle.line: Um, Commander? What should I do?

battle.speaker: Amelia
battle.line: Sir! I’m Amelia of Silva, sir! I’m new. I was only assigned to your command today. I wanted to fight for the empire!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: I don’t need your life story, fool! Recruits are in front! Grab a lance and move!

battle.speaker: Amelia
battle.line: Sir, yes sir! This lance... Stab the enemy. I’m not afraid... I’m a citizen of Grado. It’s my duty to fight. And I’ll fight my best!

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: Oh, who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: What? What?

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: Are you one of the locals? This is a dangerous spot. You should hide. Here, come with me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: But... But I’m...

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: I’m Franz, a Knight of Renais. What’s your name? What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: I-I’m Amelia. I’m... Actually, I’m a Grado soldier. I’m supposed to be fighting you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: Really? So, uh, you’re my enemy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: ...I guess... Are you... Are you going to make me your prisoner?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: No! No, I wouldn’t do that. But...this is a problem.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: What should we do?

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: First of all, you must listen to me and do as I say. We’ll talk to Princess Eirika later.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: What? NO! My commander told me Eirika’s a cruel and merciless fiend who–

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: Oh, that’s utter nonsense. I’ve never heard the princess utter an unkind word to anyone. I understand why you’re frightened. You think we’re the enemy. But if you’d only trust me... Will you come with me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: Mm... Well, all right. I’ll trust you, Franz.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: What? What?

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Are you from around here? You should find someplace to hide. These men are after me. It’s not safe.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: But... But I’m...

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Yes?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: I’m a Grado soldier. I’m here to stop the princess of Renais...

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Huh? You’re with Grado?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: And you’re Princess Eirika? But the commander said Eirika’s a cruel and merciless fiend...

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: What? No, I’m... ...I don’t know what Grado’s officers have been telling you, but... Our two countries are at war, so I suppose they can say what they want.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: ...Mistress Eirika... I, uh, I surrender. I won’t fight you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Huh?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: I became a soldier because I admired General Duessel’s sense of honor. But the generals have been very opposed to this war from the beginning... And now I see you, and you look so sad about all of this. I don’t know what’s right anymore. I’m just a soldier, but I want to decide for myself. I want to understand the truth myself, to see it with my own eyes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: ...I see. So...does this mean you’re coming with us? I suppose I should ask your name then.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: Amelia. Amelia of Silva.

boss.speaker: Binks
boss.line: Blast! This ain’t right! These guys are too tough... 5,000 gold ain’t nearly enough for this!

boss.speaker: Binks
boss.line: Th-that stinkin’ Pablo... He...lied to me...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Your Highness, are you well?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes, I believe so... Who are these men? They don’t appear to be Grado Imperial troops.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Judging by their crude swordplay, I’d say they’re mercenaries. We can expect more of them in the area, too, I think. Wait here.

end.speaker: Mercenary
end.line: W-wait! I give up! I don’t want to fight anymore! We were just doing a job.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Who hired you?

end.speaker: Mercenary
end.line: I may be nothing but a hired blade, but I have my honor. I won’t say a word.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: I admire your professionalism. I guess we have no use for you.

end.speaker: Mercenary
end.line: No, wait! I’ll talk! Carcino! It was Pablo of the Carcino Council of Elders!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Councilman Pablo?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: That doesn’t make sense! Carcino and Frelia are allies. Why would they target me?

end.speaker: Mercenary
end.line: I don’t know... Could be they’ve decided Grado’s going to win. They want to be on the winning side. Some of the others opposed Pablo, but I heard he had ’em all silenced but quick. That’s all I know, I swear it.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: I believe you. Go.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: We were careless. We should have seen this coming. Carcino’s a young and ambitious nation ruled by power-hungry merchants. And Grado grows more powerful with every passing day. So it’s no surprise Carcino’s merchant lords would throw in with Grado now.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Wait! Prince Innes... Prince Innes was to pass through Carcino on his way to Jehanna... If Carcino has betrayed us, then he ran headlong into enemy territory...

end.speaker: Messenger
end.line: Princess Eirika! I bring dire tidings!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I know you... You were a messenger riding with Prince Innes.

end.speaker: Messenger
end.line: Yes, and I have news of him. Prince Innes is in danger! Carcino’s merchant army struck and cut through half our men. The prince is trapped in a siege. He has no means of escape, and–

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: No more! I understand. Return to Frelia and deliver your message!

end.speaker: Messenger
end.line: What of Prince Innes?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Leave him to us. The prince’s troubles should burden you no more. We will see him to safety.

end.speaker: Rennac
end.line: ...Hey, you. Have Lady L’Arachel and her man, Sir Stubble-chin, gone yet?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Aren’t you– Yes, they no longer appear to be in the city.

end.speaker: Rennac
end.line: Whew... I’m finally free! No more getting bossed around by that witless ninny! Thanks. I owe you one. Take this. Now that I’m free again. I think I’m just gonna wander about for a while.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: ...What a strange relationship they have.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Lady Eirika, I think we ought to be leaving soon.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes. We must hurry to Prince Innes’s side!
